title: Open Source Font Editors
content:
Hi community !

I use to work on Fontlab but I need to try an Open Source font editor software, or at least a free one, for my students.  
Which one would you recommend?  
I must confess that I tried FontForge but find it very slow and confusing (maybe because it runs on a mac…?).  
Something more simple, for newbies type designers, would be perfect! I just want them to experimented type design: it doesn't need to be extensive.

Thank you in advance for your help!
author: Lucie Baratte

comments.content:
FontForge is the only open source font editor out there that I know of.

FontLab's TypeTool and Glyphs Mini are both inexpensive options, less than $50 USD.

You could want to investigate online browser-based tools. I know there are a few,\* but personally haven’t had time to determine their quality.

\* There also is fontstruct.com, but, while it could be a fun and instructive tool, I don’t think it would be a real first step into font editors.

**Type light** might be what you are looking for. It is freeware for Windows and Mac (and an older version is also available for Linux), and is generally considered 'easy-to-use' (as far as font editors go). The freeware version has only basic drawing tools though.

[http://cr8software.net/typelight.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419210404/http:/cr8software.net/typelight.html) (Windows)  
 [http://cr8software.net/typex.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419210404/http:/cr8software.net/typex.html) (Mac & Linux)

FontForge is acutally as mighty as FontLab, but certain builds of it are very crashy. I work in it on both Mac and Windows, works good. If you have X11 or XQuartz installed, you can get a premade build here :  
 [http://fuuko.libferris.com/osx/packages/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419210404/http:/fuuko.libferris.com/osx/packages/).  
Then just open X11, then open FontForge, should work nice (but not like a native app).

On Windows you can find a build here:  
 [http://fontforgebuilds.sourceforge.net/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419210404/http:/fontforgebuilds.sourceforge.net/)
